TEXT: The applicant , Mr PERSON , is a NORP national who was born in DATE and lives in GPE . He is represented before the ORG by PERSON , a lawyer practising in GPE . ORG ( “ the Government ” ) were represented by Mr P. GPE , the former Representative of GPE at ORG .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .
On DATE the police department of GPE of GPE started an investigation of a residential burglary committed in the district earlier ( criminal case no . DATE ) .

On DATE the police investigator questioned an eyewitness to that burglary , who identified the applicant as CARDINAL of the perpetrators . The investigator questioned the applicant , who denied involvement in that crime . The Government submitted a copy of the record of interview , signed by the applicant . On several occasions the applicant was questioned by an investigator in charge of criminal case no . DATE . However , no charges were brought against him . In DATE the investigation into the burglary was stayed .

According to the applicant , on DATE , at TIME , his car was stopped on the road . Police officers in plain clothes pulled the applicant out of his car and took him to the nearby police station . The applicant submitted that he had been arrested in connection with the burglary , and that the policemen had been trying to extort a confession from him .

At TIME a report of an “ administrative offence ” was drawn up by the police officers . The report stated that the applicant had been detained near the GPE metro station for using obscene language in a public place . The police confiscated his belongings , without making a record of what they had done , and locked the applicant in a cell .

On DATE , at TIME , the applicant was brought before a judge of ORG of GPE . The applicant claimed that he had not been given access to the case file , the judge had not allowed him to present his arguments and that , despite his requests , he had not been allowed to have a lawyer .

The judge sentenced the applicant to DATE “ administrative detention ” ( a sanction for public disturbance , provided by LAW see “ Relevant domestic law ” below ) . The court decision referred to the police report and statements of CARDINAL of the policemen who had allegedly arrested the applicant near the metro station . The text of the decision indicated that it was not subject to any appeal and that the applicant had refused to sign it . The applicant claimed that he had never been served with a copy of the decision , or even seen it . He had never refused to sign the second page of the court 's judgment , since he had not seen it . He was informed about the sentence by the policemen escorting him .
On DATE the applicant took part in an identification parade within case no . DATE .

On DATE the applicant 's relatives contacted his lawyer , who went immediately to the police station where the applicant was being detained . However , the lawyer was denied access to the applicant for the reason that the applicant was at that time being questioned by the police in connection with the burglary .
On DATE the lawyer visited the applicant in the detention facility of the police station .

On DATE the applicant 's lawyer requested ORG to give him access to the materials of the administrative case . It appears that the registry personnel and the judge searched in the archives of the court , but the case file was not found .

On DATE the applicant complained to the prosecutor 's office about his “ administrative detention ” . It appears from his complaint that he was shown a copy of the court 's decision of CARDINAL DATE but did not get access to the materials of the administrative case . He repeated his complaint on CARDINAL DATE .
On DATE the applicant was released after serving his sentence . He found his car with a broken window ; its audio system had been stolen .

The Government insisted that the applicant had been arrested at TIME near the GPE metro station for public disturbance , and that the police records were accurate . They produced a copy of the record of the arrest , which indicated that the applicant had been arrested at TIME on DATE for “ hooliganism ” . They further produced a copy of a “ record of administrative arrest ” of DATE which indicated that the applicant had been arrested under LAW . That document did not contain any information as to the particular circumstances of the offence : most of the sections of the record of the arrest had been left blank . They further produced a copy of a “ description of administrative offence ” of the same date , which indicated that the applicant had been arrested for using obscene language in a public place and for ignoring police orders . Both documents had been signed by the applicant .

They further claimed that after the hearing of DATE the applicant had refused to sign a copy of the court decision : a note stating this had been made by the judge on the court 's ruling . However , the applicant had signed the first page of the decision after the mention “ [ I ] has been informed about [ my ] rights and obligations under LAW ” . They produced a copy of the decision of DATE .

The decision contained , inter alia , a typewritten entry which indicated that the decision indicated that it was not subject to any appeal .
On DATE the applicant 's lawyer drafted an appeal against the decision of CARDINAL DATE . He indicated , inter alia , that he had not received access to the case file or even a copy of the decision .

It follows from the following correspondence and the postal receipt produced by the applicant that the appeal was sent by registered mail on DATE . On DATE the appeal reached ORG , which was supposed to send it on to ORG together with the case file .

However , on DATE ORG returned the appeal to the applicant 's lawyer . In the cover letter the judge noted that the appeal had arrived at FAC outside the time - limit established by law , and thus would not be forwarded to ORG . The letter was sent to the address of the bar association to which the applicant 's lawyer belonged . The applicant claims that his lawyer has never received this letter . According to the letter from the bar association , they have not received any letters from ORG addressed to the applicant 's lawyer .

On DATE ORG sent the applicant a letter in reply to his complaint of DATE . It can be seen from that letter that the prosecutor 's office requested the materials of the administrative proceedings from ORG . However , the request remained unanswered . Therefore , the prosecutor 's office was unable to review the lawfulness of the detention order of CARDINAL DATE .

On DATE the applicant requested ORG to restore the time - limit for lodging an appeal . He referred to the fact that , despite his request of DATE , he still did not have access to the materials of the case file and did not have a copy of the decision of CARDINAL DATE .

It is unclear what decision was taken in reply to this request . It can be seen from the letter of the Vice - President of ORG of DATE addressed to the applicant that the appeal submitted by his lawyer and dated DATE has been left unexamined since “ by its form and content it did not comply with the requirements for appeals against the court decisions in the administrative cases ” . The case file with the applicant 's request was returned to ORG .

On DATE an inquiry into the applicant 's arrest and detention was initiated . The investigator questioned the applicant and the policemen who took part in his arrest on DATE . The policemen confirmed that they had arrested the applicant for use of obscene language in a public place . The investigator concluded that the applicant 's allegations concerning the circumstances of his arrest were unsubstantiated . On DATE the investigation was discontinued .
On DATE the Vice - President of ORG informed ORG that ORG had never received any appeal from the applicant or his lawyer against the decision of DATE .

On DATE the Deputy Prosecutor of GPE lodged an extraordinary appeal against the decision of CARDINAL DATE . On DATE the Vice - President of ORG examined the case by way of supervisory review . LAW ( the Code ) of DATE ( PERSON об административных правонарушениях РСФСР ) , as in force at the relevant time ( until DATE ) , established the penalties for petty offences and the procedure for imposing the penalties . Pursuant to LAW , disturbance of public order ( which included use of offensive language in public ) was punishable with administrative detention DATE , to be ordered by a district court judge .
Under LAW of the LAW when the police arrest a person for the disturbance of public order , that person may be detained until the moment of examination of his administrative case by the court .

Article CARDINAL of the Code ( as amended in DATE and DATE ) provided that a court decision concerning an administrative offence could be appealed against to a higher court . Under Article CARDINAL an appeal could be lodged within DATE from the delivery of the decision . The time - limit for appeal , if it was not met , could be restored by the competent court upon an application by the appellant .
LAW of GPE provides as follows :
Article CARDINAL : Responsibility for damage caused by unlawful acts of ORG investigative authorities , prosecuting authorities and courts

“ CARDINAL . Damage caused to a citizen as a result of unlawful conviction , unlawful criminal prosecution , ... unlawful administrative detention ... shall be compensated at the expense of the ORG of GPE , and in the instances provided for by law , at the expense of the ORG of the subject of GPE ... in full , irrespective of the fault of the officials of the agencies ... ”

The Civil Code provides that the damage caused by an unlawful criminal prosecution should be compensated irrespective of the fault of the tortfeasor ( that is , the ORG agency which decided to prosecute , detain and so on ) . However , the notions of “ unlawful ” prosecution or detention ( see LAW ) are not developed in the relevant provisions of LAW . Certain guidelines on this subject may be obtained from Decree No . CARDINAL-X of ORG of DATE , which concerns compensation for damage caused by unlawful acts by law - enforcement agencies . For example , point CARDINAL of that Decree provides that an acquitted person has the right to obtain damages from the ORG ; the only exception concerns cases when the person was charged after making a false confession . Furthermore , in the case of PERSON ( published in the Bulletin of ORG , DATE г. , ORG , page CARDINAL ) , ORG of GPE used the following wording : “ ... unlawful attribution of criminal liability , namely when an acquittal judgment was given ... ” . These words , as well as the subsequent judicial practice suggest that the domestic courts regard criminal proceedings which ended with an acquittal to be “ unlawful ” as such . Therefore , if there was an acquittal , remand in custody would be “ unlawful ” even if all the substantive and procedural rules were complied with when it had been imposed .
